means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 赫林职业名称，卖鱼者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“鲱鱼”(herring)

sentence.Network_en: The young of some kinds of herring are canned as sardines.

sentence.Network_en: Smoked herring is a local delicacy.

sentence.Network_cn: 每次暴风雨过后海滩上都会留下数不尽的鲱鱼和螃蟹。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hǣring, hēring, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch haring and German Hering

entry.def: A herring is a long silver-coloured fish. Herring live in large groups in the sea.

means.word_mean: 1. valuable flesh of fatty fish from shallow waters of northern Atlantic or Pacific; usually salted or pickled
2. commercially important food fish of northern waters of both Atlantic and Pacific

sentences.en: Look, the situation in French agriculture is just a red herring. We’re here to discuss the situation in this country.
sentences.cn: 喂，扯法国农业问题只是在转移视线，我们要讨论的是本国的状况。
